experience.title: Software Engineering Co-op
experience.description: Added internal data analytic features to web server, providing actionable insights for the production, sales, and engineering teams. Collaborated on cross-platform (iOS, Android, Windows) app development used by customers to interface with custom hardware.

experience.title: Software Engineering Co-op
experience.description: Developed automation scripts to generate Windows .exe installers for various projects, significantly improving testing efficiency for the team. Additionally, contributed to the development and maintenance of the core DLL shared by all RF generators.

experience.title: App Developer
experience.description: Designed and implemented the underlying architecture of a cross-platform messaging application. Developed a novel syllable analysis engine for identifying Haiku poems within messages.

about.summary: From a young age, I’ve been driven by curiosity—taking apart phones, computers, and any electronics I could find to understand how they work. That passion led me to pursue a degree in Computer Science, where I’ve channeled my inquisitive nature into mastering how computers work, exploring the best technologies for specific applications, and optimizing efficiency in software solutions. I've been fortunate to intern at some great companies while pursuing my degree in Computer Science. These companies really helped me to take the skills I learned in the classroom and apply them in a practical setting. I started off with mobile app development, crafting a modern app using Flutter and Firebase to meet client specs. At MKS, I worked as a .NET developer, enhancing DLL libraries for RF generators and streamlining processes with Jenkins and JavaScript automation scripts. Most recently, at Precision Optical Technologies, I tackled everything from embedded C development and Django-based data analytics to Electron cross-platform apps, React Android development, Docker containerization, and Python APIs for engineering workflows. I’m passionate about writing efficient, impactful code and thrive in dynamic, problem-solving environments. My goal? To join a forward-thinking team where I can contribute to innovative software solutions. When I’m not coding, I’m managing and improving my homelab with a goal of de-googling my life. Let’s connect to talk tech, opportunities, or the next big project!

interests.name: Soccer
interests.description: I played soccer for about 12 years before stopping my senior year of high school after covid hit. Even though I no longer play I still like catching a BPL game every now and again. (The teams I root for are D.C United for MLS and Manchester United for BPL)

interests.name: Pickleball
interests.description: Only recently got into this sport, I enjoy playing casually with my friends when I get the chance.

interests.name: Bouldering
interests.description: Been bouldering consistently for nearly 3 years now and absolutly love it. Bouldering is essentially rock climbing without a rope on shorter routes. I like to go to the gym around 3 times a week if I'm able. (If your curious my current record for grade is V7 but difficulty depends a lot on setters.)

interests.name: Health/ Fitness
interests.description: If you couldn't tell by the amount of sports I have for hobbies I'm really into my health and fitness. Eating right and excersize are a easy cheat code to a happy life.

interests.name: Cooking
interests.description: I've recently gotten into cooking. Honestly it kind of feels like programming sometimes, taking tools and ingridients and making something amazing from nothing.

interests.name: Homelab
interests.description: I set up a home server using proxmox and TrueNAS a while ago and absolutly love it. There is just something about owning my own data and not needing to rely on the cloud for everything.

interests.name: Travel
interests.description: Seeing new places and experiencing new things is the best. To date I've been to most states on the east coast, Texas, California, Bermuda, Puerto Rico, Puerto Vallarta Mexico, and Japan.

timeline.description: I was origionally born in Daytona beach Florida where I spent the first few years of my life. I dont remember too much from that time, only hiding in my nursery with a dresser in front of the window as hurricane Charely beat down on us. From here started a long series of moves up and down the east coast.
The first destination was Michigan were we lived in Roscommon for a few years, this is where I started preschool.
Moved to Fairfax, Virginia, where I learned how to swim and started kindergarten.
Moved back to Florida, this time living on Merrit Island the space coast. I remember watching shuttle launches from my driveway with my friends.
Moved to Annapolis, Maryland where I started fourth grade. Lived here for a while getting to finish elementry and middle school before moving my Junior year of highschool.
Moved to Virginia Beach, Virginia where I got to graduate from highschool.
Graduated from Landstown Highschool in Virgnia Beach before moving to Albany, New York during the summer. Later that fall I got to start my college career at Rochester Institute of Technology.
Graduated from Rochester Institute of Technology with my degree in Computer Science.

projects.title: Haikumi
projects.summary: Ever wanted to message in Haiku form?
projects.about: Haikumi is a messaging app that allows users to communicate through Haikus.

projects.title: Remarkable File Explorer
projects.summary: Simple file explorer for the Remarkable Tablet.
projects.about: A application that interfaces with the remarkable tablet filesystem and displays it in a easy to use GUI for viewing and downloading documents.
